result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryan Kim Waddell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bryan Kim Waddell

records.addlTxt: 10:04 AM Defendant Bryan Kim Waddell in court.  Attorney Laura Kohl in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney C. James Fitzgerald in court for Bryan Kim Waddell. Court advises defendant of rights.  Elements stated.  Factual basis found. Plea Questionaire filed and reviewed. Guilty Plea entered on count #1. The Court finds the defendant guilty of count 1 and directs a JOC to be entered. Remaining counts to be dismissed and read in. Defendant advised of post conviction relief.

2:00 PM  Attorney John K Smerlinski in court for Bryan Kertess Waddell.  Attorney Laura Kohl in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Bryan Kertess Waddell in court. Atty Fitzgerald appears on behalf of the defendant on 21CM86, 22CM05 and 22CM42. Atty Smerlinski requests to be excused from the matter. The Court excuses Atty Smerklinski. Atty Fitzgerald states that there has been an offer from the state. The defendant does not wish to take the offer at this time. Defendant wishes to speak with his attorney. The Court calls a brief recess. The Court returns. Matter set over. Bond continued. Defendant states his new living address is 1057 Lake Road, Blanchardville WI but to receive mail to send it to the current address on file.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Bryan Kertess Waddell, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel C. James Fitzgerald via zoom. Laura Kohl appeared as prosecuting attorney. State believes there is no resolution. Bond continues. Matter set over.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
